category: news
title: "Real-world context increases capacity for remembering colors, shows study"
excerpt: "Human memory is fundamental to everything we do. From remembering the face of a new acquaintance to finding the cell phone that one just left on a table, one's \"visual working memory\"—the core cognitive system that retains visual information in an active state for a short period of time—plays a vital role."

    excerpt: "A new Dartmouth-led study finds that more visual information can be retained when stimuli are meaningful, demonstrating that visual working memory capacity is flexible. Understanding visual working memory capacity is integral to understanding how human cognition works."
